place.name: GRAYINGHAM
place.gazetteerText: GRAYINGHAM, a parish in Gainsborough district, Lincoln; on the Wolds, gear Ermine street, 2 miles S of Kirton Lindsey r. station, and 9 NE by E of Gainsborough. Post town, Kirton Lindsey. Acres, 1, 675. Real property, £2, 558. Pop., 135. Houses, 28. The property is all in one estate. The parish is a meet for the Brocklesby hounds. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £501. * Patron, Sir. J.Thorold, Bart. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
